intro: Asterolinon serpyllifolium, commonly known as common sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal dunes, rocky outcrops, and disturbed areas. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the stems are prostrate or ascending. Asterolinon serpyllifolium is generally hardy and resilient, capable of surviving in harsh environmental conditions.
